title: Claude Code Instructions
text: NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance commit messages NEVER reference Claude, Claude Code, AI assistance PR descriptions NEVER add Co-Authored-lines mentioning Claude Anthropic Keep commit messages focused changed, written

title: Data Source Errata
text: Arkansas package currently fetches data Annual Statistical Reports (ASR) contains primarily financial budget data, enrollment demographics (race/ethnicity breakdowns) package API designed provide.

title: Data Source Errata
text: fetch_enr() function return data frame : - is_state, is_district, is_school, is_charter - aggregation level flags - subgroup - demographic categories (total_enrollment, white, black, hispanic, etc.) - grade_level - grade breakdowns (K, 01, 02, … 12, TOTAL) - n_students - enrollment counts - pct - percentage total

title: Data Source Errata
text: ASR files contain: - ADA (Average Daily Attendance) - single count, broken demographics - Financial data (revenue, expenditure, mills, etc.) - District identifiers

title: Data Source Errata
text: ASR Excel files Arkansas Division Elementary Secondary Education contain fiscal/budget data, enrollment demographics. enrollment demographics available ADE Data Center (adedata.arkansas.gov), uses ASP.NET postback forms require session-based scraping.

title: Data Source Errata
text: proper ADE Data Center integration implemented, package provides limited functionality: - ADA counts available rough proxy enrollment - Full demographic breakdowns require manual download ADE Data Center

title: Data Source Errata
text: Implement session-based scraping ADE Data Center enrollment reports Add proper process_enrollment.R standardize raw data Add proper tidy_enrollment.R transform long format demographics

title: Data Source Errata
text: manually downloading enrollment demographics, visit: https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/ReportList/State/EnrollmentByRace.aspx

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: package provides access Arkansas school enrollment data Arkansas Department Education. Use get_available_years() see available date range:
code: get_available_years() #> $min_year #> [1] 2006 #>  #> $max_year #> [1] 2024 #>  #> $description #> [1] "Arkansas enrollment data is available from 2005-06 (end_year 2006) through 2023-24 (end_year 2024). Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education."

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: Use fetch_enr() download enrollment data single year: Use fetch_enr_multi() download multiple years :
code: # Fetch 2024 enrollment data enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # View the structure head(enr_2024) # Fetch 5 years of data enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2024)  # View year counts table(enr_multi$end_year)

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: returned data includes district-level information Arkansas Annual Statistical Reports. Key columns include: District identifiers names Average Daily Attendance (ADA) Financial budget information

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: Arkansas school data comes Arkansas Division Elementary Secondary Education (DESE): Annual Statistical Reports: District-level fiscal enrollment summary data ADE Data Center: Detailed enrollment demographics (https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/)

title: Arkansas School Enrollment: An Overview
text: default, downloaded data cached locally avoid repeated downloads. Use cache_status() check cached data: Clear cache clear_cache() needed.

title: Arkansas School Data
text: Fetch analyze Arkansas school enrollment data Arkansas Department Education (ADE) R Python. Documentation | 10 Key Insights | Getting Started

what: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: See full analysis charts data output: 10 Insights Arkansas Enrollment Data 21 years enrollment data (2005-2025). 470,000 students across 235+ districts Natural State. ten stories hiding numbers:

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
what: 1. Arkansas enrollment peaked and is declining
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas public school enrollment peaked around 2020 nearly 480,000 students declining since, following national trends.
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   select(end_year, n_students) %>%   mutate(change = n_students - lag(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Bentonville, Rogers, Springdale, Fayetteville among fastest-growing school districts state, fueled Walmart, Tyson, tech corridor.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Bentonville|Rogers|Springdale|Fayetteville", district_name)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   summarize(     y2015 = n_students[end_year == 2015],     y2025 = n_students[end_year == 2025],     pct_change = round((y2025 / y2015 - 1) * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(desc(pct_change))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Kindergarten enrollment dropped sharply pandemic parents delayed enrollment, creating smaller cohort now moving elementary schools.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2019:2023)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment",          grade_level %in% c("K", "01", "05", "09")) %>%   select(end_year, grade_level, n_students) %>%   tidyr::pivot_wider(names_from = grade_level, values_from = n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
what: 4. Little Rock is no longer the largest district
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Springdale Public Schools surpassed Little Rock School District become state’s largest, reflecting growth Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Hispanic students gone 10% 15% Arkansas enrollment, concentrated poultry-processing regions Northwest Arkansas.
code: enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2005:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "hispanic", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(end_year, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas Delta counties seen sharpest enrollment declines agricultural mechanization reduces jobs families move cities.
code: # Phillips, Lee, Chicot, Mississippi counties enr <- fetch_enr_multi(2015:2025)  enr %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL",          grepl("Phillips|Lee County|Chicot|Blytheville", district_name, ignore.case = TRUE)) %>%   group_by(district_name) %>%   filter(n() > 5) %>%   summarize(     earliest = n_students[end_year == min(end_year)],     latest = n_students[end_year == max(end_year)],     pct_change = round((latest / earliest - 1) * 100, 1)   ) %>%   arrange(pct_change)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: state’s demographics shifting, white students still comprise nearly two-thirds enrollment, Black students concentrated Central Delta regions.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian", "multiracial")) %>%   mutate(pct = round(pct * 100, 1)) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct) %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Arkansas charter schools growing, particularly Little Rock area district turmoil pushed families alternatives.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_charter, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students)) %>%   head(10) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: 60% Arkansas students qualify economically disadvantaged, one highest rates nation.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("econ_disadv", "total_enrollment")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

previous_headings: What can you find with arschooldata?
title: Arkansas School Data
text: Small rural districts consolidated absorbed, dozens districts fewer 500 students.
code: enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   filter(n_students < 500) %>%   arrange(n_students) %>%   head(15) %>%   select(district_name, n_students)

title: Arkansas School Data
code: library(arschooldata) library(dplyr)  # Fetch one year enr_2025 <- fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years enr_multi <- fetch_enr_multi(2020:2025)  # State totals enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL")  # District breakdown enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_district, subgroup == "total_enrollment", grade_level == "TOTAL") %>%   arrange(desc(n_students))  # Demographics enr_2025 %>%   filter(is_state, grade_level == "TOTAL",          subgroup %in% c("white", "black", "hispanic", "asian")) %>%   select(subgroup, n_students, pct)

title: Arkansas School Data
code: import pyarschooldata as ar  # Check available years years = ar.get_available_years() print(f"Data available from {years['min_year']} to {years['max_year']}")  # Fetch one year df = ar.fetch_enr(2025)  # Fetch multiple years df_multi = ar.fetch_enr_multi([2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, 2024, 2025])  # State totals state_total = df[(df['is_state'] == True) &                  (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                  (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')]  # District breakdown districts = df[(df['is_district'] == True) &                (df['subgroup'] == 'total_enrollment') &                (df['grade_level'] == 'TOTAL')].sort_values('n_students', ascending=False)

what: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Downloads processes school data Arkansas Department Education (ADE). Provides functions fetching enrollment data ADE Data Center Annual Statistical Reports (ASR), transforming tidy format analysis.

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: fetch_enr Fetch enrollment data school year fetch_enr_multi Fetch enrollment data multiple years tidy_enr Transform wide data tidy (long) format id_enr_aggs Add aggregation level flags enr_grade_aggs Create grade-level aggregations

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: cache_status View cached data files clear_cache Remove cached data files

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Arkansas uses hierarchical ID system: District IDs (LEA): 7 digits (e.g., 0401000 = Bentonville) School IDs: 7 digits (e.g., 0401004)

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Data sourced Arkansas Department Education systems: ADE Data Center: https://adedata.arkansas.gov/statewide/ Annual Statistical Reports: https://dese.ade.arkansas.gov/Offices/fiscal--administrative-services/publication--reports/annual-statistical-reports

title: arschooldata: Fetch and Process Arkansas School Data — arschooldata-package
text: Enrollment Grade/Race: 2005-2025 via ADE Data Center Annual Statistical Reports (detailed demographics): 2006-2024 Pre-2005 data may different formats

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Downloads returns enrollment data Arkansas Department Education.

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: end_year School year end (2023-24 = 2024). Valid range: 2006-2025. tidy TRUE (default), returns data long (tidy) format. Currently returns district-level data Annual Statistical Reports. use_cache TRUE (default), uses locally cached data available.

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
text: Data frame enrollment data

title: Fetch Arkansas enrollment data — fetch_enr
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get 2024 enrollment data enr_2024 <- fetch_enr(2024)  # Force fresh download enr_fresh <- fetch_enr(2024, use_cache = FALSE) } # }

Data comes from the Annual Statistical Reports published by the Arkansas Division of Elementary and Secondary Education." #>  # Returns list with min_year, max_year, and description
